lead_paragraph: In a message that seemed to come out of the blue, Mr. Trump took to Twitter to object to Boeing’s plans for a next-generation presidential plane.

byline.contributor: Nelson D. Schwartz and Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and CHRISTOPHER DREW

headline.print_headline: Trump Attacks Plan to Update Air Force One
headline.main: ‘Cancel Order!’ Donald Trump Attacks Plans for Upgraded Air Force One

snippet: In a message that seemed to come out of the blue, Mr. Trump took to Twitter to object to Boeing’s plans for a next-generation presidential plane....
abstract: Donald Trump takes to Twitter to criticize aircraft manufacturer Boeing for price of pending order for new Air Force One, which he says will cost $4 billion; post indicates Trump's willingness to publicly call out companies individually, first president to do so since John F Kennedy took on steel industry in early 1960s.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
